definition: consecutive serial numbers/chain (of supermarkets, hotels etc)/hyphen
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
remainder (after rounding a number)/decimal part (of number after the decimal point)/mantissa (i.e. fractional part of common logarithm in math.)/small change/balance (of an account)
desirable number (for one's telephone, licence plate etc) (i.e. one that includes memorable or auspicious combinations of digits)
large-sized (of clothes, shoes)/(old) to give an order/(old) to quit one's job in a store
to announce the winners in a lottery
to win a prize/a successful gamble
